alert.note: Alert for Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 9:01AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern New Hanover, southeastern Pender and northeastern Brunswick Counties through 930 AM EDT... At 857 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms from 5 miles north of Leland to Hampstead, moving east at 10 mph. Very heavy rain which may cause ponding of water on roadways and frequent lightning is occurring with these storms. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Surf City, Figure Eight Island, Rich Inlet, Hampstead, Topsail Beach, Hightsville, Cape Fear Community College North Campus, Wilmington International Airport, Rocky Point, Murrayville, Castle Hayne, Scotts Hill, Ogden, Woodside, Mayfaire, Wrightsboro, Topsail and Windemere. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 407 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. US Route 17 in Brunswick County near mile marker 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
